Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk cups
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: cups bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: The Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) provides a portable printing layer for Linux, UNIX, and similar operating systems. This update fixes the following bugs: Previously, it was not possible to disable SSLv3 encryption in the CUPS scheduler, which left the scheduler vulnerable to attacks against SSLv3. To fix this bug, the "SSLOptions" keyword in the /etc/cups/cupsd.conf configuration file has been extended to include two new options, "AllowRC4" and "AllowSSL3", allowing respectively the RC4 and SSLv3 features in the cupsd service. The new options are also supported in the /etc/cups/client.conf file. With this update, both RC4 and SSLv3 are disabled by default. (BZ#1161172) Previously, after a system reboot, the CUPS scheduler did not start unless a printer was connected, or until required by a local user. This meant that after rebooting a Server variant system, the CUPS scheduler was unavailable for remote systems. This bug has been fixed and the CUPS scheduler, if enabled, now starts during boot for Server installations. (BZ#1236184) Users of cups are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. After installing this update, the cupsd service will be restarted automatically. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
